hero.title: Two seas, one way of caring
hero.subtitle: A story that connects New Zealand and the Mediterranean through genuine hospitality.
hero.cta: I want to live the experience

block1.kicker: Taverna de la Sal didn’t start as a business project.
block1.p1: It began as a way of life. Matthew arrived from New Zealand with a very clear idea: hospitality isn’t a service, it’s a way of being present. For years he worked in the hospitality world and learned that quiet details are the ones truly remembered.
block1.p2: Marina grew up in L’Escala. She knows the rhythm of the sea, the character of the town, and that Mediterranean way of caring that blends closeness with calm.
quoteLines: One shared way of understanding genuine care.

block2.title: A building that already had a story
block2.p1: The building that is now Taverna de la Sal was born in the 19th century. For decades it was tied to the sea and salt. First it was a refuge for fishermen, then a welcome place for the first travelers who discovered the Costa Brava.
block2.p2: Over time, the project grew. We chose to restore the building while respecting its essence and transform it into an adults-only boutique hotel.
block2.p3: We didn’t want to create just another hotel, but an intimate space where every stay feels personal.
block2.p4: Today, Taverna de la Sal is the result of a union: tradition and a contemporary взгляд, roots and world, sea and hospitality.

philosophy.title: Our philosophy
philosophy.p1: We believe true luxury is human: being present, calling each guest by name, and caring for every detail so you can truly unwind.
philosophy.p2: "For us, hospitality isn’t a service — it’s a way of loving what we do." Mariona & Matthew

final.textLine1: If you choose to stay with us, you’re not just booking a room.
final.textLine2: You become part of a story that began long before your arrival.

third.title: Cookies de terceros
